newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan property shares up on land liguidity report.
newsitem.headline: Japan property shares up on land liguidity report.

text.p: Real estate sector shares rose across the board on the Tokyo Stock Exchange on Monday morning, pushed up by a newspaper report about the government's plan to securitise collateralised land, which is aimed at boosting liquidity in the nation's property market, traders said.
At 0041 GMT, the property sector was the third largest percentage gainer on the first section of the exchange.
As of 0044 GMT, shares in Mitsui Fudosan Co Ltd were up 20 yen at 1,390, Mitsubishi Estate Co Ltd was up 10 yen at 1,450 and Sumitomo Realty and Development Co Ltd had climbed 13 yen to 899.
